sentence.Network_en: Tommy Cook had been plaguing Pinner for months.
sentence.Network_cn: 汤米·库克已纠缠平纳好几个月了。

sentence.Network_en: He has been plaguing me with silly questions.
sentence.Network_cn: 他老是拿些愚蠢的问题来烦我.

sentence.Network_en: They hid the troubles plaguing their marriage behind a facade of family togetherness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们将困扰婚姻的问题掩藏在家庭和睦的外表之下。

PerfectNetExp.abs: You ' ve been plaguing me with silly questions all day !, 你整天用愚蠢的问题来烦扰我.

list.abs: 淋巴腺鼠疫（bubonic plague）是“瘟疫”的代名词，约在十四世纪肆虐欧洲，当时欧洲有三分之一以上的人口死于此病，所以它被欧洲 …
药物名称英语翻译(6) ... 舒硝唑 Sulnidazole 鼠疫菌苗 Plague Vaccine 双贝特 Simfibrate.
医学制药英语词汇(P2) ... plague 鼠疫 plague bacillus 鼠疫杆菌 planigraphy x 线体层照相术.
Plague on it! 该死!plague spot 鼠疫斑plague 瘟疫

entry.def: A plague is a very infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people.

example.ex: A cholera plague had been killing many prisoners of war at the time.
example.tran: 当时霍乱疫情已在夺去很多战俘的生命。

entry.def: Plague or the plague is a very infectious disease which usually results in death. The patient has a severe fever and swellings on his or her body.

example.ex: ...illnesses such as smallpox, typhus and the plague.
example.tran: 像天花、伤寒和鼠疫这样的疾病

entry.tran: （某一事物肆虐造成的）灾难，祸患
entry.def: A plague of unpleasant things is a large number of them that arrive or happen at the same time.

example.ex: The city is under threat from a plague of rats...
example.tran: 该市处于鼠患的威胁之下。

example.ex: Last year there was a plague of robbery and housebreaking.
example.tran: 去年抢劫和入室行窃成灾。

entry.def: If you describe something as a plague, you mean that it causes a great deal of trouble or harm.

example.ex: Inflation will remain a recurrent plague...
example.tran: 通货膨胀将继续成为周期性的烦扰。

example.ex: Tim seems to have escaped the cynicism which is the absolute plague of our generation.
example.tran: 蒂姆好像并没有染上我们这代人愤世嫉俗的通病。

entry.def: If you are plagued by unpleasant things, they continually cause you a lot of trouble or suffering.

example.ex: She was plagued by weakness, fatigue, and dizziness...
example.tran: 她感觉体虚、疲倦、头昏眼花。

example.ex: Fears about job security plague nearly half the workforce.
example.tran: 几乎一半的员工担心失业。

entry.def: If someone plagues you, they keep bothering you or asking you for something.

example.ex: I'm not going to plague you with a lot more questions, Miss Culver...
example.tran: 卡尔弗小姐，我不会再问更多的问题来烦你了。

example.ex: Tommy Cook had been plaguing Pinner for months.
example.tran: 汤米·库克已纠缠平纳好几个月了。

entry.def: If you say that you avoid someone or something like the plague, you are emphasizing that you deliberately avoid them completely.

example.ex: I would avoid him like the plague when his wife and my parents were around...
example.tran: 他的妻子和我的父母在旁边时，我会极力躲着他。

example.ex: I normally avoid cheap wine like the plague.
example.tran: 我一般对廉价的葡萄酒敬而远之。

entry.def: You say a plague on a particular person or thing when you are very irritated by them and do not want to bother with them any more.

example.ex: A plague on you and your damned percentages!
example.tran: 你和你该死的百分比都见鬼去吧！

auth_sentence.content: White rats are plaguing Tucson's toilets.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: White rats are plaguing Tucson's toilets.

auth_sentence.content: Or will Ferrari have to deal with the driver issues currently plaguing Red Bull?
auth_sentence.res_content: Or will Ferrari have to deal with the driver issues currently plaguing Red Bull?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Or will Ferrari have to deal with the driver issues currently plaguing Red Bull?

auth_sentence.content: Such new tools are in stark contrast to the tumbleweed-ridden intranets still plaguing many offices.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such new tools are in stark contrast to the tumbleweed-ridden intranets still plaguing many offices.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Such new tools are in stark contrast to the tumbleweed-ridden intranets still plaguing many offices.
